item.title: Report E-2023060359
item.description:
Report E-2023060359

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 30, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote containing UN3265 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately 75-gallons of product to the trailer and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Serivices, LC who dispatched a crew from E3/OMI to remediate the site. E3/OMI personnel called and requested a telehandler to remove all drums on the load. The crew deployed absorbents to the released product and contained the release. E3/OMI then transferred the remaining contents of the damaged tote into a new 275-gallon tote. All impacted paint drums were wiped off and placed back onto the trailer. The crew contained all impacted absorbents, cleanup debris, and PPE in 3 55-gallon drums. The crew secured the three (3) drums and old tote for disposal.

DescribePack: CAP LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT PLACED IN HAZMAT TOTE FOR QA

item.title: Report E-2023060131
item.description:
Report E-2023060131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 23, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 adhesive was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. The crew then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All UN1263 impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND OPEN AND THE BOX COMPLETELY DESTROYED. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND OPEN AND THE BOX COMPLETELY DESTROYED. THE LEAKAGE OCCURRED FROM ONE CONTAINER. THE LEAKAGE WAS ABSORBED THROUGHOUT THE CARDBOARD BOX. THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS ALSO DESTROYED FROM THE LEAKAGE. item.title: Report X-2023060016
item.description:
Report X-2023060016

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: BATESVILLE
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD NOTIFIED FULL TIME DISPATCH THAT THERE WAS A PACKAGE THAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID PLACARD THAT LOOKED WET IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER THEN FOLLOWED THE PROPER METHODS, STOPPED THE BELT, AND THEN DONNED HIS PPE AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS HE THEN PROCESSED THE PACKAGE AND SUBMITTED IT INTO ETT
